CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper October 5, 1957, pg. 8, reads: "Beautify Older Ladies - A project sponsored by the North Side Elks Lodge 124 and the Ideal School of Beauty Culture sent a staff of beauty operators to the Home of Aged Negro Women on Monday for free hair-styling of the older residents. Shown getting their treatments are, seated: Mrs. Dollie Johnson, Mrs. Mamie Norman, Mrs. Delma Davidson and Mrs. Blanche Smith. The operators, standing are Beatrice Starks, Sarah Reddick, Gertha Canty, Harrison Walker, Aliene Ely and Brownie Neal. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Beauticians from Ideal School of Beauty Culture Beatrice Starks, Sarah Reddick, Gertha Canty, Harrison Walker, Aliene Ely and Brownie Neal styling the hair of residents Dollie Johnson, Mamie Norman, Delma Davidson and Blanche Smith at Lemington Home for the Aged
